Commit Message: Update vapi files (#650)
Commit Description: Copied in the changes from the Shotwell vapi files and fixed up and tested the associated vala. All of these code changes relate to importing and previewing files from a camera which I've just tested still works with my Pixel 4a. I also changed how the image-missing icon is loaded in the import page as this was not working and causing criticals in the terminal. This should get us some memory leak fixes as we've now got rid of a lot of the manual memory management that wasn't done right anyway.

Merge po files, set up for intltool and l10n.gnome.org
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Make sure we show the right apps in the Open In menu
Commit Description: This removes the custom .pot file setup we had before, making it easy to translate Shotwell using the standard intltool workflow. This also merges the two separate core/extras gettext domains into one, to keep things simple.  I hope I've merged all the po files correctly, but I wouldn't bet money I did it perfectly. We also set up the help to be able to be translated on l10n.gnome.org. Closes: bgo #718783

Commit Message: Add translator comments for strftime strings: Refs bgno#716533
Commit Description: The strftime strings for local-specific date/time formats are cryptic, so hopefully these comments will help translators make the right choice.

Commit Message: Build when "-Werror=format-security" used: Closes #719863
Merge from shotwell-0.15 for 0.15.1
Crash in video interpretable check: Closes #5071
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos
Commit Description: The database and ThumbnailCache calls in check_is_interpretable are not thread-safe although check_is_interpretable was being called from a background thread.  Now check_is_interpretable returns an object with a foreground_finish() function that does the thread- unsafe work there.

Commit Message: Fix gettext problems
Commit Description: GNOME's pre-commit hooks discovered a couple of gettext problems in three translations.  This removes (by hand) the c-format specifiers that were causing the problem as well as adds the no-c-format comments in the code so the problem doesn't happen again. Finally, msgfmt -c is now used to catch these errors in the future, although the Makefile doesn't abort (like it should) when that happens.  More work necessary for that.

Commit Message: Correct language codes of PO files
Commit Description: Also fuzzify invalid translations, otherwise git.gnome.org won't let me commit.

Commit Description: The number of deprecated classes and methods in GTK 3.10 is too much work simply to get Shotwell to compile, so that's been moved to #7301.  This patch fixes some "hard" compile errors and disables warnings for deprecated symbols.

Using the "&" character in Picasa uploader causes upload to fail: Closes #6141
Closes #6994 Overwrite duplicate thumbnails

Commit Message: Build with LibRaw 0.15: Closes #7012
Commit Description: LibRaw 0.15 removed document-mode processing, which, as their release notes say, "no one uses".  Compile error were nothing more than missing symbols -- Shotwell wasn't using it either.

Commit Message: Improper French date format in sidebar: Closes #6939
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix a possible crash with invalid date and time info

Commit Message: This should fix the daily build breakage. Let's hold off on closing the corresponding ticket, however, 'til we can confirm that daily builds work again.
Make the event context menu and comment-editing dialog inform the user they'll be editing the event's comment. Fixes #6898.
Implements a highlights detail slider in the color adjustment palette to complement the preexisting shadow detail slider. Closes #752.
Delivery deftly dodges dreaded delegate duplication discouragement disaster; ref #6893.

Removes useless Glade UI files and lines of support code from the Picasa and YouTube connectors that are no longer necessary now that both connectors use the shared services of the GoogleService family of utility classes in RESTSupport.vala. Closes #6924.
Uses more specific language to describe the "strip metadata" option across all four of the core web connectors. Closes #6922 and #6923.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: New actions to copy image or metadata to clipboard

Commit Message: Removed stray 'new' keywords when initializing GLib.Mutex and GLib.Cond (both are structs); ref #6893.

Simplifies the Picasa Connector dramatically by rewriting to make use of the GoogleService support classes developed for the YouTube connector. Enables in-app hosted web authentication in the Picasa Connector. Closes #6907.
Migrate to new officially-blessed cosntructor for ThreadPool; ref #6893.
Adds support for editing the comment of an event from inside the event's page and sidebar context menu. Fixes #6904.
Fixes a problem in which the YouTube Connector would not properly cancel uploads. Closes #6908.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Factors hosted OAuth support out the YouTube connector and into a series of service-neutral utility classes. Closes #6888
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Replaces a deprecated widget in CustomComponents; ref #6893.
Replaces a deprecated constant with an allowed one; fixes #6891.
Removes a stray 'new' keyword; ref #6889.
Corrects a problem where extended info wouldn't display for videos; ref #6887.
Tries to migrate the colour-adjust tool window to use a Grid instead of a table; ref #5838.
Upgrades the YouTube connector to use OAuth 2 authentication, including in-app authentication via a hosted Webkit pane. Closes #3445.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Migrate the export dialogue box away from using Table and onto Grid instead. Ref #5838.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Move Toggle Sidebar and Toggle Photo Info actions to the main menubutton

Commit Message: Adds a check to see whether the event is null before trying to extract a comment from it; ref #6878.
Tries to merge smaller events onto larger ones whenever possible, reducing the number of operations that have to be done to complete the merge; part of ref #979 (see comment 24).
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Photos taken on the same day show under the same event

Commit Message: Shotwell now builds again with the --unity-support flag; corrects an issue where the .deps files accompanying the custom Shotwell .vapi files were not included in the distribution tarball. Closes #6859.
Migrates Shotwell's entire codebase, including plugins, to libgee-0.8. Tested with both of the (slightly different) versions of libgee that ship with Quantal and Raring, respectively. Closes #867.
Fixes an issue in which the sidebar was not properly styled. Closes #6839.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Works around a problem in glib where two on-disk directories could have different filenames that collated to the same collation key; fixes #6825.
Precaches the exposure time of Photo objects in order to speed up certain operations with them. Partial fix for ref #979.
Makes saved searches aware of photo comments. Closes #6541.
Displays the current git SHA in the Shotwell runtime log. Invaluable for debugging with users that have built from git master. Closes #3655.
Adds a configure option that allows building the Shotwell executable with profiling support. Closes #6805.
Forces '_modified's exported from camera raw images to have correct orientation. Fixes #6536.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Focus photos on startup when previewing to fix navigating with left and right arrow keys

Commit Message: Fixes an issue where duplicating a photo without an associated event would generate a soft assertion. Closes #6810.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Photos taken on the same day show under the same event

Commit Message: Fixes an issue where the key photo for an event could appear blurry in the event overview if the key photo had an extreme aspect ratio. Closes #1202.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Photos taken on the same day show under the same event

Commit Message: Corrects an incorrect addition to the THANKS file.
Fixes an issue where Shotwell failed to start when installed a certain way on Fedora systems using the new Red Hat Unified Directory Structure. Closes #5181.
Uses new EXIF metadata fields, including mapping from ratings stars to percents. Closes #5451.
Changes saved search and search filter logic such that it ignores diacritical marks (this is to say, the character 'é' is equivalent to 'e'). Closes #6670.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Fixes a grammatical error in the flagging photos progress dialog box. Closes #6457.

Fixes a missing mnemonic in direct-edit mode; fixes #6696

Commit Message: Corrects an issue where the makefile blithely assumed that all computers would already have desktop-file-utils installed; ref #6691.
Fixes a capitalization and punctuation error in the German translation file. Closes #6690.
Runs 'desktop-file-validate' on the generated .desktop files and dies early during build time if there's a problem; fixes #6570.
Commit Description: (Also corrects a problem with misc/shotwell-viewer.desktop.head)

Commit Message: Revert "Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585." (should not have been pushed)
Commit Description: This reverts commit 547e2251fe0cff819b729fb79415f165d8ed9941.

Commit Message: Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585.

Commit Message: Changes the way displaying the unmodified version of a photo is handled to use the precache and avoid a crash in direct mode; ref #6236.
Ensures that the icon associated with the startup progress dialog is the Shotwell application icon; closes #6641.
Removes all hard dependencies on X11 libraries, making Shotwell display-server agnostic and able to run under Weston/Weyland. Closes #6606.
Adds corrupt image errors to the family of errors detected by the import logging system. Closes #6445.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos

Commit Message: Makes 'configure' smarter about handling the case where no compatible libGPhoto2 installation is found; fixes #6579.
For raw files, don't use the embedded preview on the photo page if it's less than 1024 px along its major axis; closes #6594.
Fixes strftime strings that generated bogus dates in the Catalan translation. Closes #3943.
Forces the search filter to propagate to checkerboard pages when they're switched to, more closely matching what the user intuitively expects. Fixes #4300.

Commit Message: Increments version number to 0.14.0+trunk.
This is the 0.14.0 release image.
Updates French translation in preparation for the 0.14.0 release.
Modifies the video reader to ignore auxilliary video container files that come as part of AVCHD bundles. Closes #4943.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos

Commit Message: Adds missing command line options to the manpage. Closes #3998.

Commit Message: Fixes a bug in the Portuguese translation that affected generation of the .desktop file.

Changes the semantics of "unsetting" a configuration key in the GSettings configuration engine to mean "reset the GSettings key to its default value." In the past, unsetting was a no-op. Closes #6578.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix keyboard activation in tool windows

Commit Message: Changes error handling sequence in response to token refresh failures in Picasa connector to ensure users whose client IDs were changed by the previous commit are properly logged out.
Changes Picasa client ID and client secret in attempt to interoperate better with UOA.
Fixes a serious issue in which the endpoint test HTTP transaction run against the Facebook login server would fast-fail, preventing new users from logging into Facebook. Closes #6546.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Fixes numerous translation glitches and re-versions translation files to 0.14.0 in anticipation of the upcoming Shotwell 0.14 release. Closes #6431, #6424, and #6127.
Increases the time Shotwell allows the shotwell-video-thumbnailer helper process to run before killing it. Mitigates some GStreamer 1.0 issues. Closes #6519.
Corrects a problem where the extended properties box could show stale information after a raw was highlighted, then de-selected. Fixes #6500.

The video thumbnailer now seeks to a fixed value of 1 second into the video's duration in all cases. Previously, it seeked to a timecode that was determined dynamically by taking a percentage of the total video length.
Corrects a problem where .BMPs couldn't be rotated correctly if metadata-writing were turned on; fixes #3845.
Consumes 'F2' keypresses when nothing is selected in an event to prevent the sidebar from acting on them; fixes #4436.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix keyboard activation in tool windows

Commit Message: Relaxes an assertion that could fail while removing media sources from a view tracker (and logs the condition that causes the assertion); fixes #6481.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos

Commit Message: Removes an unneeded dependency; fixes #6173.
Update debian/changelog for Daily Build PPA
Replaces an assertion with a short-circuit return and a debug message. Closes #5155.

Commit Message: Prevents the background-task progress bar from appearing if there are too few tasks pending to justify it; fixes #2512.

Commit Message: Relaxes an assertion that could occasionally fail in the SourceHoldingTank, as well as adds some logging for the problem to help us address it in the future; ref #3981.
Updates version number to 0.14.0pr1+trunk.
Updates version number in Makefile and translation files for the Shotwell 0.14.0PR1 pre-release.
Works around a problem where a TreeSet could leak references when going out of scope (this led to a leak and crash in Geary); fixes #6478.
Allows compilation with both valac 0.18.x and 0.19.x. Closes #6406.
Fixes an issue where charset annotations could migrate their way into the content text of photo comments. Closes #6359.

Commit Message: Fixes an issue in which Shotwell was unable to produce thumbnails for -- and thus import -- photos generated by a recent-model Blackberry camera. Closes #6053.
Makes the search/filter bar's visibility state a persistent property, so Shotwell now remembers whether the search/filter toolbar is visible between runs. Closes #6416.
Corrects a problem where the 'Shotwell' development could be inappropriately rotated twice for portrait camera-raw images; fixes #4262.
Corrects an issue where the master's orientation could be inappropriately written to after an external edit; fixes #6430
Ensures that rejected photos are not visible at startup. Closes #4300.
Instead of rotating the pixels and dimensions on export, if we're being asked to write a JPEG, we write the pixels normally and let the orientation field do the rotation for us, fixes #1938.
Commit Description: NOTE: this does not fix the case where reverting after an external editor has set the _modified.jpg to top-left; this was broken out into its own bug.

Commit Message: Prevents multiple spurious copies of the same image from being generated when the developer is changed; closes #5681.

Commit Description: With this change the LibraryWindow's UI Manager is shared by all pages in the window.  When you switch to any page, it swaps the menus and toolbars it needs into the shared UI manager, and then swaps them back out when you leave the page. Many of the changes here were because pages were assuming that their widgets existed even when pages were not in view.  With these changes, pages can access widgets only when they are active.

Commit Description: The thumbnail fetching code was sometimes deadlocking in code which held a lock while constructing a singleton JfifFileFormatDriver or JfifFileFormatProperties object.  Vala was unfortunately initializing the lock only when the first instance of the class was created, which could be when one or more threads had already acquired and were waiting on the lock.  So these threads never continued execution after the lock was freed.  I solved the problem by eliminating the lock in these and similar classes.  We now call a static init() method earlier instead.

Commit Message: Closes #4099. The application now reaps orphaned tags automatically,
Commit Description: preventing them from crashing via the sidebar tree-graft assertion.

Commit Message: Crash fixed when undoing tag merge: #4129
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix a possible crash with invalid date and time info
Commit Description: When undoing a complex series of tag merges and moves, Shotwell would regularly crash.  The reparent tag command was holding on to Tag objects during its lifetime.  Proxies would be better, but this is problematic because we can't use a proxy as a map key.  This patch uses the tag's path (as a string) instead of a ref to the Tag itself.

Commit Message: Soft assertions during F-Spot import of duplicates: #4126
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos
Commit Description: I believe this could happen any time duplicates were detected during import.  This might solve other bugs where import is not reporting the right results.

Commit Message: Problems with Samsung NV10: #4117
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Avoid a crash when importing videos
Commit Description: Photos taken with Samsung NV10 have improper EXIF date/time format.  This patch allows for Shotwell to interpret them.  The reporter also had trouble with video creation time.  This doesn't appear to be an issue with Shotwell, as the dates were corrupted in the file. However, they exposed an overflow bug, which this patch corrects as well.

Exclude installation of gsettings-data-convert file: #4102
Commit Description: A configure option now allows the user to avoid installing the gsettings-data-convert file (shotwell.convert).  This is useful because the file must be installed in /usr/share/GConf/gsettings (and not /usr/local) for the program to locate it, which is a problem for folks who want to install as a user and not root. Also cleaned up the configure script help, which was still reflecting options no longer available.

Commit Message: 3637 fixes assertion in fullscreen mode when pressing enter
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix keyboard activation in tool windows
Commit Description: This takes care of an assertion in full screen mode.  All you have to do to hit this is go to full screen, hit Enter and then change to another photo (left, right, etc.) Why did this happen?  Well the LibraryPhotoPage interprets "Escape" and "Enter" as going back to the collection.  FullscreenWindow overrides Escape to mean leaving the full screen view; but it didn't handle Enter.  So what you were left with is a full screen view of your photo with no LibraryPhotoPage underneath.

Commit Message: 3634 fixed crash on new event
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix a possible crash with invalid date and time info
Commit Description: This fixes a rather subtle crash left over from the sidebar refactoring.  Creating a new event always creates an undated event, then populates the date when the photos are added in a second step. But the code to add undated events accidentally had swapped the comparator (used to sort the undated events) between the parent and child.

Commit Message: Fixed errors in Slovenian translation.
Fixes #3631.
Commit Description: Resolves a critical issue in which Shotwell could crash if publishing was cancelled during the file serialization phase.

Commit Message: Added strings from ratings search to pot file.
3633 translatable strings for rating search
3629 send-to with multiple users (and other multi-user /tmp bugs)
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Fix a possible crash with invalid date and time info
Commit Description: Previously we used /tmp/shotwell for exporting temp files before e-mailing or publishing. The problem with this is that if multiple users are signed in to the same machine using Shotwell, only the first user to write to /tmp/shotwell will be successful since they own the write permissions to that folder. Rather than making the folder world-writable, we're now using the folder /tmp/shotwell-{uid} so each user has their own folder.

Commit Message: Adds the REQUIRED_CFLAGS to the Makefile, which forces the setting of the PIC flag on 64-bit systems.

If CFLAGS was set externally (environment variable, command-line, or in configure.mk) we want to honor those flags.  However, the code to do that also cleared all flags passed to the plugins.  This fixes that problem.
Fixes a quibble one of the Fedora guys mentioned with the way we were naming the system library directory name option in our configure script. Re-closes #3421.
Fixes a regression in which the Flickr publisher wouldn't properly log the user out if the user's session key had expired. Closes #3442.
Following McCann's suggestion for better compliance with GNOME 3 naming standards, shortens the application name in the desktop files for both the manager and viewer.
Taking advantage of the new units in the last commit, I've moved some of the pages into their appropriate units.

Sidebar refactoring.  Large commit, to be sure, but this should make it much easier to manage the sidebar going into the future as well as put the intelligence for managing each branch in a separate compartment, where it belongs.  Other minor bugs were discovered while testing the code, fixed as well.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: The list of issues closed by this release can be found here.

Commit Message: Fixed a problem in which a non-ASCII character appeared in a string marked for translation, preventing generation of the POT file.

Commit Message: Fixes a problem in which publishing to Picasa Web Albums and YouTube would fail if a media item's title contained non-ASCII characters. Closes #3081.
Fixes two regressions introduced when the Flickr and Facebook connectors were ported from the legacy publishing API to the new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3171 and #3252.

3233: Fixes crasher caused by marking a photo Rejected and then back to Unrated while in full-window mode.  This cleans up some of the bookkeeping in ViewCollection with how hidden items are dealt with when they're selected as well.

This addresses #3016 by checking whether any of the media items in an event have altered exposure times (as opposed to the alteration type "metadata, time" which is valid for whole events, but not individual images or videos).  If one or more media items has an exposure time change, the entire event is marked as 'dirty' so the sidebar will know to re-examine the fields and refresh them.

Commit Message: 2650: Major reorganization of Shotwell source into units, which puts code of related or similar functionality into logical groupings.  Code is now "unitized" or "ununitized". Commit Message: 1110: Send pictures via Nautilus Send To integration.  #2248: Added View Event for Photo to the full-window page context menu.  #2735: Better temporary file management.  Now using /tmp and relying on the system to manage the files (i.e. delete them at boot time).  This change affects all users of temp files, the largest of which right now are the WebConnectors and Send To.

2030: Progress bar now updated as mimic manager generates mimics.  Also implemented a priority system so the various background tasks can share the progress bar.  (Worth discussing what the priorities should be.)

374: Real-time library monitoring.  Currently only available through command-line options --runtime-monitoring and --runtime-import.  Still testing to be done for scalability issues, but this represents the fundamental architecture.
Fixes bug reported by Милош Поповић.  Assertion was incorrect; it's possible for files to be removed from DirectoryMonitor during discovery.  This catches it and marks the photo as offline.

Commit Message: 2524: apport hook now distributed with tar ball.

2515: When the root of the library directory was a symbolic link, DirectoryMonitor would fail to search (not following symbolic links) and so all photos in the library would be marked offline.  Then the offline files were searched to see if they were online individually, which they all were, and so they were marked online.  This solves the problem by following symbolic links only in the directory scan.  More thorough symbolic link support needs to happen.

Commit Description: trash) and it was the last photo in an unlinked ContainerSourceCollection (i.e. a Tag or an Event), the Tag or  Event would not be destroyed.  This was being taken care of at startup when the database is verified, but that's  not the right way to handle this.  This patch adds a signal for unlinked DataSources being destroyed as orphans,  allowing for the ContainerSourceCollections to clean up appropriately.

Correspond Changelog Sentence: Focus photos on startup when previewing to fix navigating with left and right arrow keys
Commit Description: functionality.  Mousewheel events can fall through to the window even when it does not have focus.  If a  mousewheel event comes through when Shotwell loses focus with the Ctrl key down (Shift+Ctrl+M), and then the  ctrl key is released, the state will not be reset until Shotwell regains focus.  Now using the modifier flags  provided by the GDK event.

Commit Description: S90) has this problem: gPhoto will return the thumbnail for the RAW image, but no EXIF.  When the CR2 file is  copied to the local machine, it's possible to extract the EXIF from the embedded JPEG file, but not the EXIF  thumbnail.  This mismatch kills dupe detection.

Commit Message: 522: Initial commit for 8-bit RAW support.  This commit provides support for file import (but not from camera),
Commit Description: JPEG mimicking (to prevent full-sized RAW decodes and processing whenever possible), and a file format  abstraction layer in anticipation of PNG and TIFF support. Some RAW files do not display correctly; some have odd dimensions, other have color problems.  I'm investigating  these currently.  Also, to improve import time, instead of displaying a full-window pixbuf of each photo as it's  loaded, the largest thumbnail is displayed instead.  This behavior can be reinstated, if deemed important.

Commit Message: Use GTK 2.18.1 on Windows; it was the last binary version built without GTK+.
Updated the POT file.

Changed three characters in one string in the Welcome dialog: replaced three raw bullet characters ("•") with their corresponding HTML character entity codes ("•" -- correctly interpreted by Pango). This was necessary because the bullet character is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane, and the GNU gettext tools don't support strings containing characters outside of the basic ASCII plane as inputs for translation.

Replaced one character in one string: in the Welcome dialog, I replaced a typographic right arrow ("▸") with a right angle bracket (">"). This was necessary because the typographic right arrow is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane and xgettext doesn't support translation input strings that contain characters outside of the basic ASCII plane.

Commit Message: Major overhaul to improve responsiveness of editing photos and generating new thumbnails.  All modifications to the photo stored in the database are stored in the photo's original, unrotated coordinate system, which means they do not have to be adjusted whenever the image is rotated.  Some refactoring, including making Orientation a powerhouse of its own.

Major improvement to performance when moving and resizing the crop tool.  For now, the crop tool is embedded in the PhotoPage class; should be broken out in the near future.  Probably will do when another editing tool is introduced and the abstractions become more necessary.
201: Rule-of-thirds lines.  However, moving and resizing the crop is now unacceptably slow.
This fixes maintaining the crop for rotated images.  Now, crop is rotated along with image.
Crop now following photo orientation.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: Focus photos on startup when previewing to fix navigating with left and right arrow keys

Commit Message: Fixed bug where crop would fail on small photos.
60: Crop tool.
Fixed a bug in photo removal.
Performance boost on resizing thumbnails in view ... came to me over lunch.

Major refactoring in preparation for photo editing.  New Photo object centralizes pixbuf generation and photo manipulation, and introduces GObject signals into the system so various interested parties (esp. various pages) are notified when a photo is modified or removed.  Also refactored Dimensions struct, as what started out as a utility record has become a first-class citizen of Shotwell.  Also, while refactoring, went ahead and made changes to reflect Yorba's coding style (i.e. camelCase for variables -> underscored_names).  In the process, knocked out #198: Databases and thumbnail cache always in sync with modifications.  #202: Black-and-white shading with crop tool.
Basic crop UI functionality, although some UI spottiness and crop is not persisted.
Correspond Changelog Sentence: New actions to copy image or metadata to clipboard
